verses.verse: As snow <S%H7950><s%> in summer, <S%H7019><s%> and as rain <S%H4306><s%> in harvest, <S%H7105><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> honor <S%H3519><s%> is not seemly <S%H5000><s%> for a fool. <S%H3684><s%>
As the bird <S%H6833><s%> by wandering, <S%H5110><s%> as the swallow <S%H1866><s%> by flying, <S%H5774><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> the curse <S%H7045><s%> causeless shall not come. <S%H935><s%>
A whip <S%H7752><s%> for the horse, <S%H5483><s%> a bridle <S%H4964><s%> for the ass, <S%H2543><s%> and a rod <S%H7626><s%> for the fool's <S%H3684><s%> back. <S%H1458><s%>
Answer <S%H6030><s%> not a fool <S%H3684><s%> according to his folly, <S%H200><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> you also <S%H1571><s%> be like <S%H7737><s%> to him.
Answer <S%H6030><s%> a fool <S%H3684><s%> according to his folly, <S%H200><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> he be wise <S%H2450><s%> in his own conceit. <S%H5869><s%>
He that sends <S%H7971><s%> a message <S%H1697><s%> by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> cuts <S%H7096><s%> off the feet, <S%H7272><s%> and drinks <S%H8354><s%> damage. <S%H2555><s%>
The legs <S%H7785><s%> of the lame <S%H6455><s%> are not equal: <S%H1809><s%> so is a parable <S%H4912><s%> in the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of fools. <S%H3684><s%>
As he that binds <S%H6887><s%> a stone <S%H68><s%> in a sling, <S%H4773><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> is he that gives <S%H5414><s%> honor <S%H3519><s%> to a fool. <S%H3684><s%>
As a thorn <S%H2336><s%> goes <S%H5927><s%> up into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of a drunkard, <S%H7910><s%> so is a parable <S%H4912><s%> in the mouths <S%H6310><s%> of fools. <S%H3684><s%>
The great <S%H7227><s%> God that formed <S%H2342><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> things both rewards <S%H7936><s%> the fool, <S%H3684><s%> and rewards <S%H7936><s%> transgressors. <S%H5674><s%>
As a dog <S%H3611><s%> returns <S%H7725><s%> to his vomit, <S%H6892><s%> so a fool <S%H3684><s%> returns <S%H8138><s%> to his folly. <S%H200><s%>
See <S%H7200><s%> you a man <S%H376><s%> wise <S%H2450><s%> in his own conceit? <S%H5869><s%> there is more hope <S%H8615><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> than of him.
The slothful <S%H6102><s%> man said, <S%H559><s%> There is a lion <S%H738><s%> in the way; <S%H1870><s%> a lion <S%H738><s%> is in the streets. <S%H7339><s%>
As the door <S%H1817><s%> turns <S%H5437><s%> on his hinges, <S%H6735><s%> so does the slothful <S%H6102><s%> on his bed. <S%H4296><s%>

The slothful <S%H6102><s%> hides <S%H2934><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> in his bosom; <S%H6747><s%> it grieves <S%H3811><s%> him to bring <S%H7725><s%> it again <S%H7725><s%> to his mouth. <S%H6310><s%>
The sluggard <S%H6102><s%> is wiser <S%H2450><s%> in his own conceit <S%H5869><s%> than seven <S%H7651><s%> men that can render <S%H7725><s%> a reason. <S%H2940><s%>
He that passes <S%H5674><s%> by, and meddles <S%H5674><s%> with strife <S%H7379><s%> belonging not to him, is like one that takes <S%H2388><s%> a dog <S%H3611><s%> by the ears. <S%H241><s%>
As a mad <S%H3856><s%> man who casts <S%H3384><s%> firebrands, <S%H2131><s%> arrows, <S%H2671><s%> and death, <S%H4194><s%>
So <S%H3651><s%> is the man <S%H376><s%> that deceives <S%H7411><s%> his neighbor, <S%H7453><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> Am not I in sport? <S%H7832><s%>

Where <S%H657><s%> no <S%H657><s%> wood <S%H6086><s%> is, there the fire <S%H784><s%> goes <S%H3518><s%> out: so where there is no <S%H369><s%> talebearer, <S%H5372><s%> the strife <S%H4066><s%> ceases. <S%H8367><s%>

As coals <S%H6352><s%> are to burning <S%H1513><s%> coals, <S%H1513><s%> and wood <S%H6086><s%> to fire; <S%H784><s%> so is a contentious <S%H4066><s%> man <S%H376><s%> to kindle <S%H2787><s%> strife. <S%H7379><s%>
The words <S%H1697><s%> of a talebearer <S%H5372><s%> are as wounds, <S%H3859><s%> and they go <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> into the innermost <S%H2315><s%> parts of the belly. <S%H990><s%>
Burning <S%H1814><s%> lips <S%H8193><s%> and a wicked <S%H7451><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> are like a potsherd <S%H2789><s%> covered <S%H6823><s%> with silver <S%H3701><s%> dross. <S%H5509><s%>
He that hates <S%H8130><s%> dissembles <S%H5234><s%> with his lips, <S%H8193><s%> and lays <S%H7896><s%> up deceit <S%H4820><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> him;
When <S%H3588><s%> he speaks <S%H6963><s%> fair, <S%H2603><s%> believe <S%H539><s%> him not: for there are seven <S%H7651><s%> abominations <S%H8441><s%> in his heart. <S%H3820><s%>
Whose hatred <S%H8135><s%> is covered <S%H3680><s%> by deceit, <S%H4860><s%> his wickedness <S%H7451><s%> shall be showed <S%H1540><s%> before the whole congregation. <S%H6951><s%>
Whoever digs <S%H3738><s%> a pit <S%H7845><s%> shall fall <S%H5307><s%> therein: and he that rolls <S%H1556><s%> a stone, <S%H68><s%> it will return <S%H7725><s%> on him.
A lying <S%H8267><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> hates <S%H8130><s%> those that are afflicted <S%H1790><s%> by it; and a flattering <S%H2509><s%> mouth <S%H6310><s%> works <S%H6213><s%> ruin. <S%H4072><s%>
